DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of a subdivision or type of PTEN gene mutation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: This gene plays a role in signal transduction and apoptosis. It is also involved in the regulation of cell cycle progression._Any change in the DNA of a cell.  Mutations may be caused by mistakes during cell division, or they may be caused by exposure to DNA-damaging agents in the environment.  Mutations can be harmful, beneficial, or have no effect.  If they occur in cells that make eggs or sperm, they can be inherited; if mutations occur in other types of cells, they are not inherited.  Certain mutations may lead to cancer or other diseases._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: This gene plays a role in signal transduction and apoptosis. It is also involved in the regulation of cell cycle progression.:Genetic alterations found in the neoplastic lesions of the animal model. These alterations are not made intentionally.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a role in signal transduction and apoptosis. It is also involved in the regulation of cell cycle progression.
Genetic alterations found in the neoplastic lesions of the animal model. These alterations are not made intentionally.

Property.preferredDefinition: A subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of an enzyme or other protein. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule)._Any change in the DNA of a cell.  Mutations may be caused by mistakes during cell division, or they may be caused by exposure to DNA-damaging agents in the environment.  Mutations can be harmful, beneficial, or have no effect.  If they occur in cells that make eggs or sperm, they can be inherited; if mutations occur in other types of cells, they are not inherited.  Certain mutations may lead to cancer or other diseases._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position on a particular chromosome and serves as the template for a product that contributes to a phenotype or a biological function.
Genetic alterations found in the neoplastic lesions of the animal model. These alterations are not made intentionally.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated for NCI CCR Protocol in C3D.
